arts.ttl: Exeter City transfer latest on new signings and Ben Purrington absence
arts.sum: “We are working on it, close to some,” Caldwell said, when asked if he was close to making the new signings the side needs, after a sixth defeat in seven. Exeter City hope to have one new player through the door before Saturday’s League One trip to Stevenage.

arts.ttl: Exeter City thrashed 6-2 by Leyton Orient as winless run continues
arts.sum: Exeter City were booed off as their winless League One run was extended to seven after being thrashed at St James Park by Leyton Orient. Millenic Alli pulled one back two minutes into the second half, heading home from close range.

arts.ttl: Football League: Leyton Orient roar into playoff spots as Birmingham march on
arts.sum: Wrexham lose first home game in 22; Wycombe win late Millwall edge out Portsmouth; Walsall lose again Azeem Abdulai scored a hat-trick as Leyton Orient moved into the League One playoff positions with a 6-2 win at Exeter. Orient were 4-0 up after 34 minutes with two goals in two minutes from their new signing Abdulai and further goals from Sean Clare and Dilan Markanday. Millenic Alli scored twice for the hosts before Abdulai completed his hat-trick and Jamie Donley’s goal piled more misery on to the Grecians. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Richie Wellens’ in-form Leyton Orient march on after smashing Exeter
Exeter City confident they can get back on track and wins flow again
arts.sum: “Yes, we want to win games and we are disappointed with where we are, but I don’t think it’s a time to be super negative on the team, on the players. At this moment in time, we are not managing to do that but, hopefully, with players coming back from injury and hopefully with a couple of additions – and a win – it could reignite the team again and get confidence back in the team to look forward to the rest of the season.

arts.ttl: Leyton Orient set sights on 22-year-old attacker
arts.sum: Leyton Orient are interested in Maidenhead United winger Reece Smith, according to a report by Football League World.… The post Leyton Orient set sights on 22-year-old attacker appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Caleb Watts signs new Exeter City contract as Kamari Doyle departs
arts.sum: Exeter City have confirmed that Caleb Watts has signed a contract extension until the end of the 24/25 season. “I just want to play well, score goals and do well for myself and the club and repay the faith and If I’m rewarded with a longer contract then brilliant."

arts.ttl: Exeter City's Gary Caldwell left exasperated over refereeing decisions
arts.sum: Exeter City manager Gary Caldwell admitted that the 3-1 defeat at home to Blackpool was not down to the refereeing team. None of the three goals in which the Tangerines scored in the first half had anything to do with the poor performance of referee James Oldham, assistant Jack Clench and Samuel Fudge, and fourth official Scott Chalkley.

arts.ttl: Jayden Stockley on how Exeter City has a special place in his heart
arts.sum: “I look back at Exeter as just being such a fantastic football club with great stability”, Stockley said to SkyBet. The 31-year-old spent two spells with the Grecians and said that he had a fantastic time at St James Park, albeit tinged with sadness that he couldn’t help City to a promotion.

arts.ttl: ‘Too compelling to ignore’ – Leyton Orient boss tipped for future move by reporter
arts.sum: Leyton Orient boss Richie Wellens has been tipped to attract interest from elsewhere by reporter Chris Dunlavy. Leyton… The post ‘Too compelling to ignore’ – Leyton Orient boss tipped for future move by reporter appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
